description: Back-formation from upholsterer (“tradesman who finishes furniture”), from Middle English upholdester, from Middle English upholder (“dealer in small goods”), from upholden (“to repair, uphold”); equivalent to uphold +‎ -ster.

entries.meaning: (archaic) An upholsterer; a tradesman who finishes furniture.

verbs.description: upholster (third-person singular simple present upholsters, present participle upholstering, simple past and past participle upholstered)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To fit padding, stuffing, springs, webbing and fabric covering to (furniture).
